attributes.action: David Camean must continue as PM as he is popular elected Prime Minister
attributes.additional_details:
David Camaran is one of the best and successful Prime Ministers of the United Kingdom and in no way it is his fault that Refrendum results turned out against his campaign. On the contrary it is fault of Boris Johnson who joined the campaign, which was based on lies and let millions of conservative votes down who respected Boris Johnson.
I have met Boris Johnson as I have a lot of respect for him but now I am disappointed as he turned an opportunist politician eager to becom PM.
attributes.background: I am a senior citizen of the United Kingdom and admirer of British Democracy. But the campaign for 23 June Refrendum was contrary to democratic principle as many people have been deceived by campaign based of lies. There is a  ask for Second Refrendum.

rejection.details: This is a personal decision for Mr Cameron, and not the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament.
